common_issues.title: PiecesOS Fails to Boot Past Core Dependencies
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS desktop app on macOS and Windows gets stuck on "Ensure Core Dependencies" during startup. This occurred after recent updates, potentially due to data migration or conflicts. Solutions include updating to the latest version, restarting the app or computer, reinstalling, and waiting for a patch from the Pieces team.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation #613: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)

**Key Points:**

* **Issue:** PiecesOS gets stuck during boot-up and doesn't fully launch.
* **Reported by:** Multiple users, including Shamas-Habib, JasonDWilson, and rogierlegit.
* **Platforms affected:** Windows and macOS.
* **Symptoms:**
    * PiecesOS icon appears briefly in the top bar and then disappears.
    * os_server.exe process appears in task manager but no system tray icon.
    * PFD (Pieces File Downloader) cannot connect.
    * A web page warning that PiecesOS couldn't start is displayed.
* **Possible causes:**
    * Major data migration during the 11.1.0 update.
    * Issues with OneDrive conflicting with PiecesOS.
    * General bug in PiecesOS.
* **Solutions attempted:**
    * Restarting the app and computer.
    * Reinstalling PiecesOS.
    * Manually restarting PiecesOS.
    * Checking for updates.
    * Removing OneDrive database.
    * Closing and re-opening the app.
* **Outcome:**
    * Issue was resolved for some users after updating to 11.1.1 and 11.1.2 versions.
    * Issue persists for rogierlegit on macOS, but can be temporarily resolved by closing and re-opening the app.
    * A patch is being developed to prevent the issue from happening in the future.

## Current Status:

* Issue is resolved for some users.
* A patch is being developed for the remaining users.
* Users are advised to update to the latest version of PiecesOS and close and re-open the app if the issue persists.

## Recommendations:

* Update to the latest version of PiecesOS.
* If the issue persists, try closing and re-opening the app.
* If the issue still persists, report it to the Pieces team through the app or their support channels.
* Wait for the patch to be released.

## Additional Notes:

* The issue appears to be more prevalent on macOS.
* The issue may be related to the major data migration during the 11.1.0 update.
* OneDrive may be interfering with PiecesOS in some cases.
* The Pieces team is actively working on resolving the issue.

related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* johnkennyuk is experiencing issues with account linking between their Github and Google accounts.
* The current account linking flow is not user-friendly and is being replaced.
* The new system should be ready by the end of February.

**Problems Identified:**

* The current account linking flow is not straightforward.
* There is a potential capitalization issue with johnkennyuk's email addresses.
* Account linking is not handled by Pieces and the auth service is being replaced.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces offered to manually merge the accounts.
* Johnkennyuk suggested waiting for the new system to be implemented.
* Mark-at-pieces reset johnkennyuk's Github account 
* johnkennyuk agreed to wait for the new system.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The new system is not yet ready.
* Johnkennyuk will wait for the new system and will be one of the first to try it out.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation is ongoing and may be updated in the future.
* Johnkennyuk is happy to wait for the new system and is confident that it will resolve the issue.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Rohanrathi99 reported issues making requests to Pieces' cloud services and experiencing problems with local models.

* Rohanrathi99 shared a link to the log files with access granted for mark@pieces.app.
* After reviewing the logs, mark-at-pieces requested a call to delve deeper into the problem.
* Rohanrathi99 scheduled a meeting for further investigation on 2025-02-24 at 23:30.

**Problems Identified:**

* Rohanrathi99 is unable to make requests to Pieces' cloud services.
* Rohanrathi99 is facing problems with local models.
* No apparent cause found after log review.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces requested and reviewed logs for analysis.
* Mark-at-pieces proposed a call for further troubleshooting.
* Rohanrathi99 scheduled a meeting for detailed investigation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Meeting scheduled for February 24, 2025 to investigate the root cause.
* Outcome pending investigation and potential solution implementation.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Ollama Server Errors in Pieces OS

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `johnkennyuk` encountered Cuda errors with Ollama Server on Pieces OS.
* Errors related to `cublas64_12.dll` and only occurred with Pieces OS instances.
* User suspected corrupted installations and tried reinstalling both Pieces OS and Ollama.
* User assumed it might be related to startup order, as Ollama Server required a full restart of Pieces OS.

**Problems Identified:**

* Incomplete/broken Ollama installation causing server errors.
* Possible conflict between Pieces OS bundled Ollama instance and user-installed instance.
* Startup order causing issues if user-installed Ollama starts before Pieces OS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Uninstalling and reinstalling Ollama using the official installer.
* Checking and cleaning up environment variables like PATH.
* Disabling automatic Pieces OS launch on sign-in.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue resolved itself after multiple uninstalls and path cleanups, possibly due to conflicts being resolved.
* However, the user is still experiencing the issue occasionally.
* User inquired about Pieces OS detecting external Ollama instances to prevent conflicts.

**Further Action:**

* Investigate and implement a mechanism for Pieces OS to detect and avoid conflicts with user-installed Ollama instances.
* Explore options to avoid conflicts due to startup order.

**Additional Notes:**

* The timeline of the conversation spans multiple months from December 2024 to February 2025.
* The user expressed appreciation for the assistance provided by `brian-at-pieces`.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**
* @GetReal444 experienced an issue booting up PiecesOS.
* Error logs indicated a problem with the database extension requiring AVX2 support, which was not available on @GetReal444's processor.
* This issue seemed to affect more users than initially anticipated.

**Problems Identified:**
* Database extension not compatible with @GetReal444's processor due to missing AVX2 support.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and actively sought solutions.
* A patch was prepared and deployed within a few days.
* Users were recommended to update to the latest version (11.1.2) of PiecesOS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* The issue has been resolved with the 11.1.2 update.
* @GetReal444 confirmed the issue was fixed after updating.

**Additional Notes:**
* This issue appeared to be related to other reported issues (#624, #625).
* The response time of the Pieces team was appreciated by users.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving PiecesOS launch failures:** The most frequent and active tickets revolve around PiecesOS failing to launch, particularly after updates (versions 11.1.0 and 11.1.1). Focus on addressing the root causes, such as database errors, hardware incompatibility (AVX2 support), and conflicts with external installations (Ollama).
**Improve account linking process:** Users report persistent issues with linking Google and GitHub accounts. Investigate and simplify the account linking flow to ensure a smoother user experience.

**Enhance communication about hardware requirements:** The introduction of stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1 caused launch issues for many users. Clearly communicate any changes in system requirements in release notes and update documentation to avoid similar situations in the future.

**Develop a more robust database extension:** Issues related to the 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extension and database errors are prevalent. Investigate and address the underlying causes to improve the extension's stability and compatibility.

**Provide clear guidance on resolving cloud service connection errors:** Users encounter difficulties connecting to cloud services and local LLMs. Improve troubleshooting documentation and provide clear steps for users to diagnose and resolve connectivity problems.

**Investigate and address Ollama integration issues:** Conflicts between Pieces OS and externally installed Ollama instances are reported. Explore options for better integration, such as automatic detection and configuration of external Ollama installations.
**Proactively monitor system stability and performance:** Implement monitoring tools and processes to identify potential issues early on and prevent widespread outages or disruptions.

**Gather detailed user feedback on specific error messages:**  Vague error messages like "Unable to sign in! We aren't sure what happened." are not helpful for users or support staff.  Capture more context-specific information to aid in troubleshooting and resolution.
